hanzi-su-wiki:
覚

Значения

Ощущать; запоминать, выучивать; просыпаться; осознание; осознать, прозреть, понять сущность

Мнемоника

  • Сокращение. Видеть 見 в истинном свете, устранив покров невежества 学 (без нижней части).

  • "Мы запоминаем, что мы видим 見 в школе."

Варианты

覺, 觉

覚覚RS
X		remember, learn, awake, make awake
  • visual 見 education 龸 awakens the mind
 学 修 習; 起

覚覚RSto wake up from sleep, conscious, memorize, learn, remember
  • waking from sleep one sees 見 things one has learned 龸 to recognize: you remember
heisig_constituent: memorize, schoolhouse, owl, crown, see, telescope, eye, human legs
heisig_story: The idea of memorizing things is easily related to the schoolhouse; and since we have been at it for more than a hundred pages in this book, the idea that memorizing involves seeing things that are not really there should make it easy to put the two elements together.
Keyword_KKLC:
PERCEIVE, sense; realize
WAKE UP
COMMIT TO MEMORY
Keyword_KANJIDIC: memorize, learn, remember, awake, sober up
koohiiStory1: In a schoolhouse in class: 1) you see something on the blackboard, then 2) you memorize it.
koohiiStory2: You´ll never memorize all the kanji by seeing them in a school house. You need Heisig and RtK!
kunYomi: おぼ.える、さ.ます、さ.める、さと.る
jp_example_words:
覚え(おぼえ): memory, sense, experience
錯覚(さっかく): optical illusion, hallucination
視覚(しかく): sense of sight, vision
自覚(じかく): self-conscious
聴覚(ちょうかく): the sense of hearing
味覚(みかく): taste, palate, sense of taste
目覚しい(めざましい): brilliant, splendid, striking, remarkable
目覚める(めざめる): to wake up
覚悟(かくご): resolution, resignation, readiness, preparedness
感覚(かんかく): sense, sensation
覚ます(さます): awaken, disabuse, sober up
覚める(さめる): wake, wake up
目覚し(めざまし): alarm clock (abbreviation)
覚える(おぼえる): remember, memorize
jp_readingExamples: 覚える (おぼ.える), 覚ます (さ.ます), 覚める (さ.める)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic:
Viking see, Viking memorize. That’s how Vikings learn things. They see something, and then they memorize it. Quite simple, really.
It can also mean awake. Just remember that a viking can't see if it isn't awake. There won't be anything to memorize if their eyes are still closed, after all!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: How else would a Viking memorize something? Imagine having to memorize sea charts for your Viking navigation. Look and see the maps in your brain as you memorize them.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Every morning, a cock (かく) crows and rouses the Vikings. Seeing this, one of the Vikings memorizes the cock crow so that he can mimic it and play pranks on his fellow Vikings.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine yourself memorizing the sound of a cock crow and using it to play jokes on your fellow Vikings. Cock-a-doodle-doo!
Ru_Meaning: memorize, learn, remember, awake, sober up
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you see (見) it in the classroom (龸), but do you remember it?

覚

Значения

Ощущать; запоминать, выучивать; просыпаться; осознание; осознать, прозреть, понять сущность

Мнемоника

  • Сокращение. Видеть 見 в истинном свете, устранив покров невежества 学 (без нижней части).

  • "Мы запоминаем, что мы видим 見 в школе."

Варианты

覺, 觉

Radicals: 見  (see, viking)
Meaning Mnemonic
Viking see, Viking memorize. That’s how Vikings learn things. They see something, and then they memorize it. Quite simple, really.
It can also mean awake. Just remember that a viking can't see if it isn't awake. There won't be anything to memorize if their eyes are still closed, after all!
How else would a Viking memorize something? Imagine having to memorize sea charts for your Viking navigation. Look and see the maps in your brain as you memorize them.
Reading Mnemonic
Every morning, a cock (かく) crows and rouses the Vikings. Seeing this, one of the Vikings memorizes the cock crow so that he can mimic it and play pranks on his fellow Vikings.
Imagine yourself memorizing the sound of a cock crow and using it to play jokes on your fellow Vikings. Cock-a-doodle-doo!
